articles.title: Perplexity’s Comet is the AI browser Google wants - The Verge
articles.description: Perplexity has launched Comet, an AI-powered browser that feels like the agentic experience that Google wants to put inside Chrome.

articles.title: Nothing Phone 3 review: Nothing ventured, nothing gained - Ars Technica
articles.description: The Nothing Phone 3 is the company’s best phone by a wide margin, but is that enough?

articles.title: The Most Interesting Email I Ever Received: Remembering the Incredible Life of DIY Geneticist Jill Viles - ProPublica
articles.description: In 2013, ProPublica reporter David Epstein was contacted by a woman with a wild story and a batch of photos she believed were clues to the mystery of her condition. Turns out, she was right.

articles.title: Apple sues leaker Jon Prosser for stealing iOS secrets - The Verge
articles.description: Prosser has been accused, together with Michael Ramacciotti, of secretly accessing an Apple employee’s development iPhone to leak key iOS details.

articles.title: Donkey Kong Bananza's monologuing villains have turned me: It's time Nintendo properly embraces fully voice acted characters - Eurogamer
articles.description: DK Bananza has a new rogues' gallery in the form of the VoidCo Kongs - but these villains might be a little better if they spoke a bit of the King's.

articles.title: Porsche Unveils Type 992.2 GT3 Cup Car - Sportscar365
articles.description: Porsche confirms new Type 992.2-based 911 GT3 Cup car for 2026 debut...
